metadata.subject: History
metadata.description: NC History topic instantiations — specific study choices within curriculum concepts
metadata.note: Topics represent specific exemplars or school choices within abstract curriculum requirements. is_optional=true means the school selects from a choice_group. is_prescribed=false means the topic is an open slot filled by the school.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: 'Changes within living memory. Where appropriate, these should be used to reveal aspects of change in national life' — statutory prescribed study category. School chooses the specific focus (e.g. toys, transport, technology).

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'events beyond living memory that are significant nationally or globally', alongside first aeroplanes and Moon landings.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'events beyond living memory that are significant nationally or globally'.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'events beyond living memory that are significant nationally or globally'.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'lives of significant individuals in the past who have contributed to national and international achievements'. Contrasted with Mary Seacole in NC guidance.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'lives of significant individuals in the past'. NC explicitly notes Mary Seacole as a comparison figure to Florence Nightingale.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'lives of significant individuals in the past who have contributed to national and international achievements'.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'lives of significant individuals in the past who have contributed to national and international achievements'.

topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'lives of significant individuals in the past who have contributed to national and international achievements'.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'lives of significant individuals in the past who have contributed to national and international achievements'.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'lives of significant individuals in the past who have contributed to national and international achievements'.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: Named exemplar for 'lives of significant individuals in the past who have contributed to national and international achievements'.

topics.topic_name: Significant Local or National Events and Commemorations
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS1 History: 'Significant historical events, people and places in their own locality' — statutory requirement; school determines the specific local context.

topics.topic_name: Changes in Britain from the Stone Age to the Iron Age
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: 'Changes in Britain from the Stone Age to the Iron Age' — statutory prescribed study. Covers hunter-gatherers, Bronze Age religion/technology, Iron Age hill forts.

topics.topic_name: The Roman Empire and its Impact on Britain
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: 'The Roman Empire and its impact on Britain' — statutory prescribed study. Covers Caesar's invasions, Roman Empire, British resistance, Romanisation.

topics.topic_name: Britain's Settlement by Anglo-Saxons and Scots
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: 'Britain's settlement by Anglo-Saxons and Scots' — statutory prescribed study. Covers Roman withdrawal, Anglo-Saxon invasion, kingdoms, early Christian missions.

topics.topic_name: The Viking and Anglo-Saxon Struggle for the Kingdom of England
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: 'The Viking and Anglo-Saxon struggle for the Kingdom of England to the time of Edward the Confessor' — statutory prescribed study.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: 'A local history study' — statutory prescribed requirement. School determines the specific local focus, which may include a significant local site, event or period.

topics.topic_name: A Study of an Aspect or Theme in British History Beyond 1066
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: 'A study of an aspect or theme in British history that extends pupils' chronological knowledge beyond 1066' — statutory requirement. School chooses the specific theme (e.g. the Tudors, the British Empire, World War II).

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: One of four named options for 'the achievements of the earliest civilizations — an overview of where and when the first civilizations appeared and a depth study of one of the following: Ancient Sumer; The Indus Valley; Ancient Egypt; The Shang Dynasty of Ancient China'.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: One of four named options for the earliest civilisations depth study.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: One of four named options for the earliest civilisations depth study. Most widely taught option in English primary schools.

topics.topic_name: The Shang Dynasty of Ancient China
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: One of four named options for the earliest civilisations depth study.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: 'Ancient Greece — a study of Greek life and achievements and their influence on the western world' — specifically named and statutory, unlike the ancient civ depth studies which are a choice group.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: One of three named options for 'a non-European society that provides contrasts with British history — one study chosen from: early Islamic civilization, including a study of Baghdad c. AD 900; Mayan civilization c. AD 900; Benin (West Africa) c. AD 900–1300'.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: One of three named options for the non-European contrasting society study.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS2 History: One of three named options for the non-European contrasting society study.

topics.topic_name: Development of Church, State and Society in Medieval Britain 1066–1509
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: 'the development of Church, state and society in Medieval Britain 1066–1509' — statutory prescribed theme. Includes Norman Conquest, Magna Carta, the Black Death, the Hundred Years War, the Wars of the Roses.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: 'the Elizabethan age' — statutory prescribed theme. Covers religious settlement, the Spanish Armada, exploration and early colonialism.

topics.topic_name: Development of Church, State and Society in Britain 1509–1745
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: 'the development of Church, state and society in Britain 1509–1745' — statutory prescribed theme. Covers the Reformation, the English Civil War, the Restoration, the Glorious Revolution.

topics.topic_name: Ideas, Political Power, Industry and Empire: Britain 1745–1901
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: 'ideas, political power, industry and empire: Britain, 1745–1901' — statutory prescribed theme. Covers the Industrial Revolution, political reform, the British Empire, slavery and abolition.

topics.topic_name: Challenges for Britain, Europe and the Wider World 1901 to Present Day
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: 'challenges for Britain, Europe and the wider world 1901 to the present day' — statutory prescribed theme. Covers World Wars I and II, decolonisation, the Cold War, post-war Britain.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: 'the Holocaust' — explicitly named as a statutory requirement within the KS3 programme of study. Distinct from and additional to the broader 20th-century theme.

topics.topic_name: A Study of an Aspect or Theme in World History
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: 'at least one study of a significant society or issue in world history and its interconnections with other world developments (for example, Mughal India 1526–1857; China's Ming dynasty 1368–1644; Aztec/Inca empires c1500; 17th century Europe; the nature and development of communist states in the 20th century; the USA in the 20th century)'. School selects the specific focus.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: Schools must include study of at least one non-European society. Aztec or Inca empires are among the named exemplars.

topics.topic_name: An Islamic Civilisation (e.g. Mughal India or Ottoman Empire)
topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: Schools must study at least one Islamic civilisation. Named exemplars include Mughal India 1526–1857. School selects the specific civilisation.

topics.subject: History
topics.curriculum_note: NC KS3 History: '17th century Europe' among named exemplars for world history study. School chooses the specific European focus outside Britain.
